DataElement.preferredName: Meddra System Organ Class WHO Adverse Reaction Terminology Code java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Highest level of the terminology, and distinguished by anatomical or physiological system, etiology, or purpose._A terminology for coding clinical information in relation to drug therapy, used throughout the WHO Program by member countries and around the world by pharmaceutical companies and clinical research organisations. It has been developed over more than thirty years to serve as a basis for rational coding of adverse reaction terms.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Highest level of the terminology, and distinguished by anatomical or physiological system, etiology, or purpose.

Concepts.definition: Highest level of the MedDRA terminology, and distinguished by anatomical or physiological system, etiology, or purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: A terminology for coding clinical information in relation to drug therapy, used throughout the WHO Program by member countries and around the world by pharmaceutical companies and clinical research organisations. Concepts.definition: A terminology for coding clinical information in relation to drug therapy, used throughout the WHO Program by member countries and around the world by pharmaceutical companies and clinical research organisations. It has been developed over more than thirty years to serve as a basis for rational coding of adverse reaction terms.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
